channel.title: How do I make a simple quest?
channel.description: How do I make a simple quest? I wanted to simplify Horror from the deep, just where you have to kill the dagg mother. And you then you get your choice of the god books.

item.title: How do I make a simple quest?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

The code that I gave you earlier, it isn’t functional. It won’t work if you try to use it.

This isn’t a spoonfeeding community, try Googling terms that you’re not sure of.

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/datatypes.html
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/switch.html

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make a simple quest?

item.title: How do I make a simple quest?
item.dc:creator: @Project_Territh Project Territh
item.description:
@Project_Territh wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:18, topic:534566”][quote author=Project Territh link=topic=653367.msg4377875#msg4377875 date=1382591317]
public boolean completedQuest = false;

/Wherever it handles NPCs./
switch (npcId) {
case SOMENPCID:
/*
* blah, blah, blah
*/
completedQuest = true;
break;
}
i tried adding this but i have no idea where to put it into the npc handler file because where ever i place it it gives me errors. I just want to know how to start a quest from scratch. and the steps to doing so
[/quote]That isn’t copy and paste code.

  1. Create a boolean to check quest completion.
  2. Find the switch statement that handles NPCs, create another case label for the NPC you’re using for the quest and once it’s killed, have it switch the boolean to true.[/quote]

I’m new to java and i have absolutely no idea what that means.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make a simple quest?

item.title: How do I make a simple quest?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

[quote=“Project Territh, post:15, topic:534566”]public boolean completedQuest = false;

/Wherever it handles NPCs./
switch (npcId) {
case SOMENPCID:
/*
* blah, blah, blah
*/
completedQuest = true;
break;
}
i tried adding this but i have no idea where to put it into the npc handler file because where ever i place it it gives me errors. I just want to know how to start a quest from scratch. and the steps to doing so[/quote]That isn’t copy and paste code.

  1. Create a boolean to check quest completion.
  2. Find the switch statement that handles NPCs, create another case label for the NPC you’re using for the quest and once it’s killed, have it switch the boolean to true.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make a simple quest?
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:9, topic:534566”][quote author=Project Territh link=topic=653367.msg4377855#msg4377855 date=1382588674]

[code=java]public boolean completedQuest = false;

/Wherever it handles NPCs./
switch (npcId) {
case SOMENPCID:
/*
* blah, blah, blah
*/
completedQuest = true;
break;
}

/Wherever it handles item requirements, should already have something like this./
switch (itemId) {
case BOOKID:
if (completedQuest == false) {
//blah
}
break;
}[/code]

Where do I enter this? I’m using delta base btw
the first one Npchandler.java?
2nd one item handler.java?
Thank you, both of you
[/quote]Yes, Delta handles NPCs in npcHandler. It might be itemhandler that handles item requirements, just find the file that handles other item requirements.[/quote] no the item reqs im pretty sure its handled in client.java in the wear boolean cough

Read full topic

case SOMENPCID:

/Wherever it handles item requirements, should already have something like this./

}[/code]
